channel.title: Dark Reading
channel.description: Dark Reading: Connecting the Information and Security Community
channel.copyright: Copyright (C) 2000-2021 Dark Reading - All rights reserved.

item.title: Almost Half of Former Employees Say Their Passwords Still Work
item.description: It's not hacking if organizations fail to terminate password access after employees leave.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Microsoft, Fortra & Health-ISAC Team Up to Remove Illicit Cobalt Strike Tools
item.description: The effort aims to disrupt the use of altered Cobalt Strike software by cybercriminals in ransomware and other attacks.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: TikTok, Other Mobile Apps Violate Privacy Regulations
item.description: App developers are ignoring laws and guidelines regulating data protection measures aimed at minors, putting their monetization plans in jeopardy and risking user trust.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Eddy, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Close the Permissions Gap With Identity And Access Management For Multicloud Workforces
item.description: Consolidating identity management on one platform gives organizations real-time access management for all identities on hybrid and multicloud installations. (First of a two-part series.)
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Security, Microsoft

item.title: Printers Pose Persistent Yet Overlooked Threat
item.description: Vulnerabilities in the device firmware and drivers underscore how printers cannot be set-and-forget technology and need to be managed.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Bad Actors Will Use Large Language Models — but Defenders Can, Too
item.description: Security teams need to find the best, most effective uses of large language models for defensive purposes.
item.dc:creator: Rob Gurzeev, CEO & Co-Founder, CyCognito

item.title: Cybercriminals 'CAN' Steal Your Car, Using Novel IoT Hack
item.description: Your family's SUV could be gone in the night thanks to a headlight crack and hack attack.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Fight AI With AI
item.description: By developing new tools to defend against adversarial AI, companies can help ensure that artificial intelligence is developed and used in a responsible and safe manner.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Care, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Twitter 'Shadow Ban' Bug Gets Official CVE
item.description: A flaw in Twitter code allows bot abuse to trick the algorithm into suppressing certain accounts.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: 'BEC 3.0' Is Here With Tax-Season QuickBooks Cyberattacks
item.description: In next-gen, credential-harvesting attacks, phishing emails use cloud services and are free from the typical bad grammar or typos they've traditionally used (and which users have learned to spot).
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Montalbano, Contributor, Dark Reading

item.title: Australia Is Scouring the Earth for Cybercriminals — the US Should Too
item.description: It's time to get ahead of attacks before they even happen.
item.dc:creator: Chris Bowen, Founder & CISO, ClearDATA

item.title: It Takes AI Security to Fight AI Cyberattacks
item.description: New threats from generative AI demand a generative AI security response.

item.title: What to Discuss at RSA Conference — and It's Not ChatGPT
item.description: In-person conversations are a productive way to understand the state of the industry and learn new techniques. Take advantage of peers' experience, compare notes, and boost your skill set.
item.dc:creator: Nigel Houghton, Director of Marketplace and Ecosystem Development, ThreatQuotient

item.title: Styx Marketplace Provides Hub for Financial Cybercrime
item.description: An emerging, illicit marketplace proves that financial cybercrime is still on the rise, with a need for countries to collectively put safeguards in place.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: The Pope's Security Gets a Boost With Vatican's MDM Move
item.description: Faced with enterprise challenges, the Holy See looks to ensure it avoids a "holey" mobile device management solution.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Noname Security Announces Hardened API Security Platform
BlackBerry Introduces Integrated Solution to Assure Secure Bi-Directional Response Communications During Cyber Incidents
item.description: BlackBerry integrates award-winning CylanceGUARD and BlackBerry AtHoc technologies for "combat-ready" cyber event continuity planning and response.

item.title: Garage Door Openers Open to Hijacking, Thanks to Unpatched Security Vulns
item.description: CISA is advising Nexx customers to unplug impacted devices until the security issues are addressed — but so far, it's crickets as to patch timeline.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: AppSec Looms Large for RSAC 2023 Innovation Sandbox Finalists
item.description: Application security is the dominant trend for this year's startup contest, but AI, blockchain, and compliance are all represented as well.
item.dc:creator: Karen Spiegelman, Features Editor

item.title: Researcher Tricks ChatGPT Into Building Undetectable Steganography Malware
item.description: Using only ChatGPT prompts, a Forcepoint researcher convinced the AI to create malware for finding and exfiltrating specific documents, despite its directive to refuse malicious requests.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: FBI Seizes Genesis Cybercriminal Marketplace in 'Operation Cookie Monster'
item.description: The homepage of a widely used Dark Web forum for stolen cookies and other compromised data has been replaced by a seizure notice by the US federal law enforcement agency.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Montalbano, Contributor, Dark Reading

item.title: QNAP Zero-Days Leave 80K Devices Vulnerable to Cyberattack
item.description: Multiple QNAP operating systems are affected, including QTS, QuTS hero, QuTScloud, and QVP Pro appliances, and some don't yet have patches available.
item.dc:creator: Becky Bracken, Editor, Dark Reading

item.title: 3 Fronts in the Battle for Digital Identity
item.description: As both digital protection strategies and digital attacks become more sophisticated, organizations that know the terrain have a better chance of navigating it.
item.dc:creator: Vyacheslav Zholudev, Co-Founder & CTO, Sumsub

item.title: New GRC Platform TrustRegister Links Risk to Revenue Impact
item.description: The application allows companies to proactively surface risks and remediation plans via programmatic risk assessments.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Cybereason Secures $100M in Funding Led by SoftBank Corp.
item.description: Cybereason announces additional funding led by Softbank Corp.

item.title: Industrial Defender Launches Phoenix: OT Visibility & Security Solution for Small to Midsized Operations
item.description: Phoenix addresses the critical need for smaller operators to secure their operations with an easy-to-use and cost-effective OT security solution.

item.title: CardinalOps Launches MITRE ATT&CK Security Layers for Measuring Detection Posture
item.description: Enables enterprises to operationalize MITRE ATT&CK and build a multi-layered, threat-informed defense to eliminate gaps based on organizational risk and priorities.

item.title: F5 Safeguards Digital Services With New AI-Powered App and API Security Capabilities
item.description: Enhanced API defenses, granular machine learning capabilities, and new managed service offerings provide comprehensive protection across distributed environments.

item.title: Law Firm for Uber Loses Drivers' Data to Hackers in Yet Another Breach
item.description: Uber gave sensitive data on drivers to a law firm representing the company in legal actions, but the data appears to not have had adequate security protections.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: eFile Tax Return Software Found Serving Up Malware
item.description: In the height of tax-return season, a popular tax prep software service leaves a malicious JavaScript file online for weeks.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Akamai Launches Managed Security Service Updates and New Premium Offering
item.description: Customers have increased access to Akamai security experts to help protect from sophisticated cyberattacks.

item.title: Mysterious 'Rorschach' Ransomware Doubles Known Encryption Speeds
item.description: The malware is one of the most sophisticated ransomwares ever seen in the wild, and marks a leap ahead for cybercrime.
item.dc:creator: Tara Seals, Managing Editor, News, Dark Reading

item.title: 15M+ Services & Apps Remain Sitting Ducks for Known Exploits
item.description: Scans of the Internet find that millions of computers, virtual machines, and containers are vulnerable to one or more of the hundreds of cyberattacks currently used in the wild, despite being patchable.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: What RASP Should Have Been
item.description: When runtime application self-protection is held to a higher standard, it can secure thousands of applications and prevent burnout in security teams.
item.dc:creator: Doug Ennis, CEO, Waratek

item.title: How Strategic Investors Can Help Cybersecurity Startups
item.description: Cybersecurity startups face pressure during this economic uncertainty, but strategic investors can help them succeed in providing tech that defends against cyberattacks.
item.dc:creator: Michael Sentonas, President, CrowdStrike

item.title: Designing Tabletop Exercises That Actually Thwart Attacks
item.description: Have you ever wondered how they design blue team exercises? One ransomware and cyber extortion simulation demonstrates the best practices.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: 'Proxyjacking' Cybercriminals Exploit Log4j in Emerging, Lucrative Cloud Attacks
item.description: Proxyjacking is an emerging, low-effort and high-reward attack for threat actors, with the potential for far-reaching implications.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Montalbano, Contributor, Dark Reading

item.title: DoJ Recovers $112M in Crypto Stolen With Romance Scams
item.description: Authorities claw back funds from six crypto accounts they say were linked to a "pig-butchering" cybercrime ring.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: 3CX Breach Widens as Cyberattackers Drop Second-Stage Backdoor
item.description: "Gopuram" is a backdoor that North Korea's Lazarus Group has used in some campaigns dating back to 2020, some researchers say.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: For Cybercrime Gangs, Professionalization Comes With 'Corporate' Headaches
item.description: They rake in millions, but now, as much as zero-days and ransoms, cybercriminals are dealing with management structures and overhead.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Data Breach Strikes Western Digital
item.description: The company behind digital storage brand SanDisk says its systems were compromised on March 26.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: How Good Is Your Advanced Threat Management?
item.description: Whether protecting a financial institution or a hospital, everyone needs an effective strategy for fending off slippery threats like those that hide in memory.
item.dc:creator: Michael Gorelik, CTO, Morphisec

item.title: Name That Edge Toon: Tower of Babble
item.description: Come up with a clever caption, and our panel of experts will reward the winner with a $25 Amazon gift card.
item.dc:creator: John Klossner, Cartoonist

item.title: 4 Steps for Shifting Left & Winning the Cybersecurity Battle
item.description: If companies prioritize communications and make the DevOps process more transparent, team members will better know what vulnerabilities to look for.
item.dc:creator: Sascha Giese, Head Geek, SolarWinds

item.title: Elastic Expands Cloud Security Capabilities for AWS
item.description: Launching CSPM, container workload security, and cloud vulnerability management to modernize cloud security operations.

item.title: The FDA's Medical Device Cybersecurity Overhaul Has Real Teeth, Experts Say
item.description: The physical and cyber safety issues surrounding medical devices like IV pumps is finally being meaningfully addressed by a new policy taking effect this week.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Mimecast Report Reveals Nearly 60% of Companies in UAE and Saudi Arabia Need to Increase Cybersecurity Spending
item.description: The State of Email Security Report reveals cyber risk commands the C-suite's focus.

item.title: Pro-Islam 'Anonymous Sudan' Hacktivists Likely a Front for Russia's Killnet Operation
item.description: "Anonymous Sudan" has been claiming that its DDoS attacks are in retaliation for anti-Islamic activities, but at least one security vendor is suspicious about its true motives.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Adaptive Access Technologies Gaining Traction for Security, Agility
item.description: With companies pushing to adopt zero-trust frameworks, adaptive authentication and access — once languishing — looks finally ready to move out of the doldrums.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Is Decentralized Identity About to Reach an Inflection Point?
item.description: Decentralized identity products are increasingly projected to be introduced to the market in the next couple of years.
item.dc:creator: Don Tait, Senior Analyst, Omdia

item.title: Vulkan Playbook Leak Exposes Russia's Plans for Worldwide Cyberwar
item.description: Russian intelligence services, together with a Moscow-based IT company, are planning worldwide hacking operations that will also enable attacks on critical infrastructure facilities.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Eddy, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: US Space Force Requests $700M for Cybersecurity Blast Off
item.description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine spurs Space Force to seek astronomical investments in cybersecurity.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: What CISOs Can Do to Build Trust & Fight Fraud in the Metaverse
item.description: Until a degree of confidence is established, a platform's credibility can be eroded by scammers and unsuspecting gamers who fall victim to their attacks.
item.dc:creator: Yoav Keren, CEO, BrandShield

item.title: Post-Quantum Satellite Protection Rockets Towards Reality
item.description: A successful multi-orbit cryptography test beamed quantum-agile data up to two different satellites and back down to Earth.
item.dc:creator: Tara Seals, Managing Editor, News, Dark Reading

item.title: Automatic Updates Deliver Malicious 3CX 'Upgrades' to Enterprises
item.description: In a SolarWinds-like attack, compromised, digitally signed versions of 3CX DesktopApp are landing on user systems via the vendor's update mechanism.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: BEC Fraudsters Expand to Snatch Real-World Goods in Commodities Twist
item.description: Business email compromise scams are moving beyond just stealing cash, with some threat actors fooling companies into sending goods and materials on credit, and then skipping out on payment.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: How to Solve IoT's Identity Problem
item.description: Network protocols can be used to identify operating systems and discern other device information.
item.dc:creator: Asaf Fried, Data Scientist, Cato Networks

item.title: Microsoft Patches 'Dangerous' RCE Flaw in Azure Cloud Service
item.description: The vulnerability would have allowed an unauthenticated attacker to execute code on a container hosted on one of the platform's nodes.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Montalbano, Contributor, Dark Reading

item.title: Organizations Consider Self-Insurance to Manage Risk
item.description: Risk reassessment is shaking up the cybersecurity insurance market, leading some organizations to consider their options, including self-insurance.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Eddy, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: DataDome Closes $42M in Series C Funding to Advance the Fight Against Bot-Driven Cyberattacks and Fraud
item.description: The investment will fund global commercial rollout and R&D efforts to debilitate fraudsters.

item.title: Socura Launches Managed SASE (MSASE) Service
item.description: SASE reduces security & connectivity costs and improves employee experience.

item.title: Stop Blaming the End User for Security Risk
item.description: Don't count on securing end users for system security. Instead, focus on better securing the systems — make them closed by default and build with a security-first approach.
item.dc:creator: John A. Smith, CEO, Conversant Group

item.title: Spera Takes Aim at Identity Security Posture Management
item.description: ISPM is a combination of identity attack surface management and risk reduction, as well as identity threat prevention, detection, and response.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Top Tech Talent Warns of AI's Threat to Human Existence in Open Letter
item.description: Elon Musk, Steve Wozniak, and Andrew Yang are among more than 1,000 tech leaders asking for time to establish human safety parameters around AI.
item.dc:creator: Becky Bracken, Editor, Dark Reading

item.title: Trojan-Rigged Tor Browser Bundle Drops Malware
item.description: Attackers are targeting cryptocurrency accounts belonging to users in Russia and more than 50 other countries.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Patch Now: Cybercriminals Set Sights on Critical IBM File Transfer Bug
item.description: A vulnerability with a 9.8 CVSS rating in IBM's widely deployed Aspera Faspex offering is being actively exploited to compromise enterprises.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Phishing Emails Up a Whopping 569% in 2022
item.description: Credential phishing emails are the clear favorite of threat actors, with a 478% spike last year, new research shows.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Cybersecurity Investment Outlook Remains Grim as Funding Activity Sharply Declines
item.description: Security analysts expect little improvement until at least the second half of the year.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Using Observability to Power a Smarter Cybersecurity Strategy
item.description: With an infrastructure for observability, security teams can make better decisions about access and identity-based threats.
item.dc:creator: Dan Conrad, AD Security and Management Team Lead, One Identity

item.title: Google: Commercial Spyware Used by Governments Laden With Zero-Day Exploits
item.description: Google TAG researchers reveal two campaigns against iOS, Android, and Chrome users that demonstrate how the commercial surveillance market is thriving despite government-imposed limits.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Montalbano, Contributor, Dark Reading

item.title: The CISO Mantra: Get Ready to Do More With Less
item.description: For the foreseeable future, with the spigots closing shut, CISOs will need to find ways to do more with less.
item.dc:creator: Steve Benton, Vice President of Threat Research & General Manager Belfast, Anomali

item.title: How Does Data Literacy Enhance Data Security?
item.description: With the rise in cloud-based security concerns and other issues, organizations must improve data literacy across the enterprise.
item.dc:creator: Sam Rehman, SVP and Chief Information Security Officer, EPAM Systems

item.title: Microsoft Security Copilot Uses GPT-4 to Beef Up Security Incident Response
item.description: Microsoft's new AI assistant tool helps cybersecurity teams investigate security incidents and hunt for threats.
item.dc:creator: Fahmida Y. Rashid, Managing Editor, Features, Dark Reading

item.title: MacStealer Malware Plucks Bushels of Data From Apple Users
item.description: A novel cyber threat against macOS users is being sold for $100 a pop on the Dark Web, and activity is ramping up.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: NullMixer Polymorphic Malware Variant Infects 8K Targets in Just a Month
item.description: The NullMixer loader has compromised thousands of endpoints in the US, France, and Italy, stealing data and selling it to Dark Web data dealers, all without setting off alarm bells.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Millions of Pen Tests Show Companies' Security Postures Are Getting Worse
item.description: A lack of website protections, Sender Policy Framework (SPF) records, and DNSSEC configurations leave companies open to phishing and data exfiltration attacks.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Bitwarden Announces Secrets Management With a Combination of Open Source, End-to-End Encryption, and Ease of Use
North Korea's Kimsuky Evolves into Full-Fledged, Prolific APT43
item.description: In cyberattacks against the US, South Korea, and Japan, the group (aka APT43 or Thallium) is using advanced social engineering and cryptomining tactics that set it apart from other threat actors.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Montalbano, Contributor, Dark Reading

item.title: Hey, Siri: Hackers Can Control Smart Devices Using Inaudible Sounds
item.description: A technique, dubbed the "Near-Ultrasound Inaudible Trojan" (NUIT), allows an attacker to exploit smartphones and smart speakers over the Internet, using sounds undetectable by humans.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Spend on Safety Measures & Call Out Insecure Practices for Safer IoT
item.description: IoT risk and security must get more attention from vendors and support from the marketplace.
item.dc:creator: Joe Marshall, Senior IoT Security Strategist, Cisco Talos Intelligence Group

item.title: How CISOs Can Reduce the Danger of Using Data Brokers
item.description: Without proof that it was collected legally, purchased data can threaten an enterprise's security compliance and even expose the company to litigation.
item.dc:creator: Evan Schuman, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: CISA Releases Hunt Tool for Microsoft's Cloud Services
item.description: CISA released the hunt and response tool to help defenders extract cloud artifacts without performing additional analytics.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Clop Keeps Racking Up Ransomware Victims With GoAnywhere Flaw
item.description: After several weeks and more than 130 ransomware victims, GoAnywhere parent company Forta issues a statement.
item.dc:creator: Becky Bracken, Editor, Dark Reading

item.title: Twitter's Source Code Leak on GitHub a Potential Cyber Nightmare
item.description: Indicators point to Twitter's source code being publicly available for around three months, offering a developer security object lesson for businesses.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: 7 Women Leading the Charge in Cybersecurity Research & Analysis
item.description: From rising stars to veterans heading up research teams, check out our profiles of women making a big impact in cyber defense as the threat landscape expands.
item.dc:creator: Ericka Chickowski, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Drive to Pervasive Encryption Boosts Key Management
item.description: Key vaults, aka key-management-as-a-service (KMaaS), promise to allow companies to encrypt sensitive data across cloud and third parties with granular control.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Cybersecurity vs. Everyone: From Conflict to Collaboration
item.description: Don't assume stakeholders outside security understand your goals and priorities, but consider how you'll communicate with them to gain their support.
item.dc:creator: Lenny Zeltser, Chief Information Security Officer, Axonius

item.title: CyberSecure Announces Strategic Alliance
item.description: The joint partnership represents expanded market opportunities.

item.title: Tesla Model 3 Hacked in Less Than 2 Minutes at Pwn2Own Contest
item.description: In two days, ethical researchers from 10 countries have unearthed more than 22 zero-day bugs in a wide range of technologies at the annual hacking contest.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: GitHub's Private RSA SSH Key Mistakenly Exposed in Public Repository
item.description: GitHub hastens to replace its RSA SSH host key after an exposure mishap threatens users with man-in-the-middle attacks and organization impersonation.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Zoom Zoom: 'Dark Power' Ransomware Extorts 10 Targets in Less Than a Month
item.description: A new threat actor is racking up victims and showing unusual agility. Part of its success could spring from the use of the Nim programming language.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Malicious ChatGPT Extensions Add to Google Chrome Woes
item.description: The second malicious ChatGPT extension for Chrome has been discovered, giving malicious actors access to users' Facebook accounts through stolen cookies.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Eddy, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Red Teaming at Scale to Uncover Your Big Unknowns
item.description: A contrarian mindset with applied imagination allows security professionals to assess problems in their organizations, prevent failures, and mitigate vulnerabilities.
item.dc:creator: Charles (Chuck) Randolph, Chief Security Officer, Ontic

item.title: Application Security Requires More Investment in Developer Education
item.description: If you haven't done so already, it's time to take the first step toward solving this application security dilemma.
item.dc:creator: Amy Baker, Security Education Evangelist, Security Journey

item.title: Open Source Vulnerabilities Still Pose a Big Challenge for Security Teams
item.description: Open source software continues to pose a challenge for companies. With the proper security practices, you can reduce your open source risk and manage it.

item.title: 'Nexus' Android Malware Targets Customers of 450 Financial Institutions Worldwide
item.description: Nexus, offered in a malware-as-a-service model, is the latest in a vast and growing array of trojans targeting mobile banking and cryptocurrency applications.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Bundestag Bungle: Political Microtargeting of Facebook Users Draws Ire
item.description: With shades of the Cambridge Analytica scandal, German political parties skirted consumer data privacy regulations during the country's last parliamentary election, a privacy watchdog warns.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: The Board of Directors Will See You Now
item.description: Help the board understand where the business is vulnerable, where controls end, and where exposure begins.
item.dc:creator: Marc Gaffan, CEO, Ionix

item.title: Epidemic of Insecure Storage, Backup Devices Is a Windfall for Cybercriminals
item.description: Enterprise storage devices have 14 security weaknesses on average, putting them at risk of compromise by cyberattackers and especially ransomware attacks.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: MITRE Rolls Out Supply Chain Security Prototype
item.description: Cloud-based System of Trust application now available for test-driving quantitative risk assessment of suppliers of hardware, software, services.
item.dc:creator: Kelly Jackson Higgins, Editor-in-Chief, Dark Reading
